title: Ratio of forces on orbiting satellites

content.question: How does the magnitude of the gravitational force <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> between the planet and satellite in orbit <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> compare to the magnitude of the gravitational force <math alttext="F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> between the planet and satellite in orbit <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub A equals 2 F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub A equals 3 F sub C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub A equals 4 F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub A equals 12 F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub A equals 16 F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub A equals 16 F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
